Human aging is a process that happens to all living things, including people. As we grow older, our bodies change in many ways. One way is that our cells, which are the tiny building blocks of our bodies, divide and reproduce less often. This means that our bodies have a harder time repairing themselves when they get hurt or sick. Another change is that our metabolism, which is how our bodies use energy, slows down. This can make it harder to maintain a healthy weight. As we age, our senses also become less sharp. For example, we might not see or hear as well as we used to. This can make it harder to do some of the things we enjoy, like reading or going to concerts. Human aging is like a long journey. It's not just about getting older, but also about how our bodies and minds change over time. Imagine you are a tiny seed. When you're young, you're small and need lots of care. But as you grow, you get stronger and bigger. You change in many ways. Your body grows, you learn new things, and you can do more. Aging is like this too, but in reverse. Our bodies and minds don't grow bigger, but they still change. Our skin gets wrinkles, our hair turns gray or white, and we might not be as strong as we used to be. But we also gain wisdom and experiences that make us unique. It's important to remember that everyone ages differently, just like how different plants grow at different speeds and in different ways.

**Paragraph:**

Aging is a natural process that happens to everyone as time passes. You might have noticed that some people look different as they grow older. Their skin might have tiny lines called wrinkles, and their hair might turn gray or white. This happens because our bodies change over time. As we age, our bodies don't work as fast or as well as they used to. We might not run as quickly or see as clearly. But, aging also makes us wiser. We learn more and remember more things from our past.

Text:
Step 1: Think about how to explain 'human aging' to someone reading at the Upper Elementary level.
Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.
Step 3: Write a paragraph of 200 words that follows your plan. Make sure to include the following information:
- As humans grow older, their bodies change.
- These changes are a natural part of aging.
- The changes can be physical, like getting taller or having gray hair.
- The changes can also be mental, like learning new things or remembering less.
- Scientists are still studying why these changes happen.

Human aging is a process that occurs naturally as we live our lives. When we are babies, we grow quickly, and then our growth slows down as we get older. Our bodies change in many ways as we age. Some of these changes are physical, like when we grow taller or when our hair turns gray. Our brains also change as we get older. We might find it easier to learn new things when we are young, but we might also start to forget things more often as we get older. Scientists study these changes to try and understand why they happen and how we can stay healthy as we age.
